alert.note: Alert for Bryan (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 1:44AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, in southeast Georgia, Bryan and Chatham. In southeast South Carolina, Beaufort, Colleton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 345 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 141 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated numerous showers and thunderstorms developing along the upper Georgia coast and the Savannah Metro Area into Beaufort County, South Carolina. Some locations have already received an inch of rain since midnight. As these showers and thunderstorms move across the region, localized amounts in excess of 3 inches will be possible. Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas will be possible through 345 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilton Head Island, Bluffton, Beaufort, Port Royal, Tybee Island, Edisto Beach, Bellinger Hill Area, Fort Pulaski National Monument, Wilmington Island, Hutchinson Island, Downtown Savannah, Midtown Savannah, Hunter Army Airfield, Windsor Forest, Coffee Bluff, Clarendon, Jasper, Montgomery, Garden City and Hardeeville.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
